intro: Descurainia incana var. major, commonly known as hoary tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit and thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive, grayish appearance. It is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to stabilize soils and provide habitat for pollinators.
